rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: She was okay. I'm a native speaker & was expecting more from her class. Even though she's Spanish she would sometimes use English and it was fairly annoying for a 200 level class where we're supposed to use the opportunity to improve our pronunciation. Class requires lots of reading. She's very nice and approachable! Work hard & you'll get an A.

I hate literature, but she made it pretty enjoyable. She is one hundred percent there for you and will save your butt if you go to office hours. I still go back and ask her for help! She is really sweet and although she isn't always the best at english, she will meet you halfway. I'm terrible with analysis and she really helped.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Best professor at UNC. Classes are easy and his lectures are highly academical. He is very lay back but really cares about his student .
Alan was a great professor. He connects with students and keeps things reasonable. I wish I had taken more classes with him.
it was very entertaining having alan as a professor. he is very nice and knowledgable. the class is very laid back

I would say this is definitely the professor to take if you're just trying to finish your FL credit. He makes tests as easy as he can (listening sections) and doesn't assign much homework, especially toward the end of the semester. However, if you want to actually learn Spanish, he's probably not the best choice. He's pretty confusing sometimes

He's very easy. If you're serious about learning Spanish, I'd say that you should opt for someone a little more difficult. If you don't care about learning and just want FL credit, he's the man for you. Very little homework, very easy grading on the tests.

If you take this class and do the work (basic worksheet style), you will pass. This class, however, was awful to sit through. Despite talking in English a LOT, he was still impossible to understand when he taught grammar. Does not finish sentences!! He ended up waxing philosophical the whole time... and being rather rude when students didn't agree.
Prof Re is awesome. He really knows the subject and you can ask him any question. Very flexible and open. He really helps a lot.

Professor Re**** is easy going, very relax and knowledgeable. He doesn't teach much yet he guides well. I only needed a D to graduate and was not planning to study much, however, I did a lot of homework without even being aware. His class was super fun and I learned a great deal. Highly recommend his class!
Redik is a SUPER EASY teacher, and pretty chill. however, he refuses to teach actual spanish. A nice guy, though.

Prof. Re**** is hard. At the first part of the semeste he kills you with homeworks but then you set you free. He lets you work on your own terms. I ended with an A and I was expecting a C+ hen I started. He knows what he is doing.

This is the easiest professor I have ever had at Carolina. HOWEVER, he will not teach you anything. He refuses to help in class and tells people to look up answers online instead. I want to minor in Spanish and if you want to learn at all DO NOT take this class.
Great professor. Very intelligent and extremely knowledgeable. The discussions are highly philosophical and he will help you a lot with your grammar.
Alan is the man. He grades great, but he will teach if you are interested. He helped me out when I asked. He only cares about grammar when you write compositions, not so much subject matter.

Pretty cool guy. The readings are really hard of you are coming from SPAN 204. They are do-able though. He gives a lot of help on what to know for the test so pay attention on review days! Grades pretty easily.
Alan Re**** is the bomb. His class was easy and he really tried hard to help you make good grades. On the downside he can be a bit flighty, so don't expect your papers or tests back anytime soon.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Martín is great honestly. He's low key hilarious and he cares about his students. Unfortunately he does not design the tests for 204 otherwise they would be much easier. Most of the class is participation based and he really emphasizes conversation. 8/10 would recommend

Awesome professor. He does have a heavy accent (from Argentina), but if you are in 204 you shouldn't have problems with this. Class participation is very important and definitely helps your grade. Sueldo makes sure that everyone is involved in the material and incorporates a lot of group work in the lessons. Huge focus on speaking and conversation.
Very clear about what he wants, easy and interesting readings. He's low-key funny. This was one of the easiest Spanish classes I've taken because he teaches very well
Great teacher will help you if you show the effort.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: He's by far my favorite professor at UNC! He is hilarious and really cares about his students. Just make sure to do your homework and participate in class! He makes it easy to participate, and is incredibly helpful, so don't be afraid if you say the wrong answer. He will give you the grade you deserve, but he is a wonderful teacher!

Professor Gomez planned each class well, and his powerpoints were both informational and HILARIOUS. His class was always entertaining, and he really cares about his students. If you want to learn a language at all, he will care about your learning and help you succeed. Definitely the most I've ever learned of a language in one semester.

LOVE HIM. very tough, but it's hard not to like him. Spanish 260 was my favorite class, because it was actually interactive. He got us to participate daily. If you do the readings and study all the time, it won't be too bad. Expect pop quizzes and he's also a harsh grader!

THE BEST PROFESSOR I have ever had. He is a kind and caring professor, a joy to talk to, makes hilariously entertaining and yet educational powerpoints. Do everything you can to take a class with him. He is fantastic.

El profesor Gómez is an understanding, passionate, and funny teacher. Speaking classes are always uncomfortable when you're learning, but he was incredibly helpful during office hours. Anyone who refers to his class as "my dear students" and means it clearly cares. Show him you do as well and you're golden.

Gomez is quite possibly the greatest professor you will ever have. He doesn't give out grades that you don't deserve but he cares so much about the material and his students and is hilarious. He's the sweetest man and calls his class "my dear students". If you work hard, participate and study you will do well. Go to his office hours!!

Professor Gómez is a fantastic teacher. He makes an effort to get to know all of his students and get them excited about learning Spanish. He's studied pretty much everything so if you have a question, he has the answer. Not the easiest professor, but certainly very rewarding.

A great guy, really interesting and really loves his students.  However, he does not make the class easy and 99% of the learning has to be done at home, out of the book, which sucks.  If you can easily learn Spanish on your own I would definitely recommend taking him over someone else but if you generally have a hard time I would reconsider SPAN204
Prof. Gomez clearly loves his job. He is very interesting and funny and makes classes easy to enjoy. He's a really wonderful professor.

Really nice guy!!! Go talk to him after class!!! He has some interesting stories to tell!!!! However,  he teaches way too much out of the book and I didn't learn much of anything in his class.  The book was really bad so the class was often boring.  Gomez is a great guy though.  Really cares about his students!
Best teacher ever, very funny and kind. The class is not hard at all and he grades easily on papers.

He is a great teacher who loves teaching Spanish.  He is probably the best professor I have had at UNC.  Definitely take his class if you have the chance - you will not regret it.  He keeps things funny during class and is very laid back during class.

He's a sweet man who cares about teaching a lot. He's very non-threatening which makes it easy to worry less about mistakes. I've had nothing but good professor in this department, but he was by far the best.

AMAZING! one of the best spanish  professors I've had so far - he's extremely enthusiastic and his little Powerpoints are wonderful - and sometimes humorous. fun class - just participate, don't worry about messing up. He's not intimidating at all and will help you with whatever you need.

He was an amazing professor! He was so interested in his subject and his powerpoints were a little slice of heaven! (If you have him you'll see what I mean)Maybe the best professor I've ever had in Spanish and maybe even school period.
Fantastic professor. I had a great experience and plan on taking more classes with him in the future.
Very energetic about teaching.  Really want students to succed and will work with them in this regard.
He wants to be a poet... and turns out he is one. Do not get wrapped up in the philosophical stuff. Ohh yea... pretend you really care about Spanish and he will seriously LOVE you. Love = A
No Comments
an awesome spanish teacher--willing to work with you and presents material in an understandable manner. classwork isn't necessarily easy, but its fun and he's a good teacher

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: I didn't really like her at all. When speaking English at times, she makes it sounds like she's more knowledgeable than you. She takes forever to hand back grades and is a very disorganized professor. The class in general can be easy, but she was a bit too much for me.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Please do not take this class as a first year seminar. There are 4 papers (2 worth 10% of your grade and 2 worth 40%). The average grades were 85-95 on the 10% papers, but of course the 40% midterm was graded harder. There are so many more interesting seminars that could be taken. She is very unclear, not organized and never stays on topic.

This was a great class. Professor Perelmuter is very fair. The class consists of two paper grades and two essay format exams. Professor Perelmuter tends to give out grades anywhere in the 80s to the low 90s. She also records attendance and uses that to help raise or lower your overall average. The novels we read in class were also pretty good.
Dr. Perelmuter is really nice and takes the time to meet with confused students outside of class if they are struggling.  She comes off mildly intimidating in class, but she's actually very sweet.

I met with her to figure out which classes I needed to take over the summer to graudate. She would not count one course I had taken for my major becuase she did not feel that the course was hard enough to count- even though it was listed as a course that counted. Luckily, another advisor caught her 'mistake' and fixed it.

I don't think people that have made the previous comments have gotten to know professor Perelmuter very well. She is wonderful, very resourceful and always willing to help students. She is in my thesis committee and has been one of the most helpful persons in it. She is very knowledgeable and a great scholar.

This woman was my advisor. She almost ruined my life lying about courses. She was a pisspoor advisor. She gave me advice one day and literally the next day had vacated her office without one word. I was up the creek. She didn't mention one word the day before. She's evil, avoid her!

Dr. Perelmuter, despite her Cuban background, doesn't seem to be able to communicate effectively the causes behind many problems that plague Latin America. Our class discussions, which she tried to dominate, were meaningless and trite, and completely based on conjecture. Avoid at any cost!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: I can not stress more how amazing Ms. Amat is! This class was the best I've taken so far- she is excited about the material, engaging and halarious. While participation is necessary, she makes it easy. The assignments and readings are interesting and workload isn't hard at all. Final project is a movie project that she grades fairly on. TAKE HER!!

Dr. Amat is a very sweet lady, but I did not enjoy her class. The curriculumwork from SPAN 105 is the same no matter your teacher, but Dr. Amat grades significantly harder than any other professor. I wouldn't mind but I felt I came out of the class having learned nothing. Be ready to work.

Dr. Amat is one of the most passionate professors I've had. She is always willing to help and has an obvious passion for what she teaches. Dr. Amat does grade quite difficultly, but that only makes you more prepared for 203.

Tough grader but she teaches a lot in class. A lot of span 105 profs play games, which she doesn't, but she you end up learning more than any other prof will for 105 which prepares you for the tests. She really cares about her students and is accepting and helpful with questions. Friendly woman. Lively and energetic

She is a tough teacher no doubt. But she is helpful and nice to all her students and you can definitely tell she cares about their success. If you are willing to go to her office hours she will answer all your questions.

Dra. Amat is a fun, engaging, lively teacher. Her class is challenging but you learn so much from the discussions. There are few essays through the course and one final video project which is fun. She is a tough but fair grader. If you work hard and put effort into the class, you can definitely get an A. She is very helpful and I enjoyed her class!

Class is disorganized and not always interesting, but it's not so bad.  Tests and quizzes can be difficult.  If you're not comfortable with Spanish, then I would look for another professor.  She moves quite quick and as a native speaker speaks very fast.  It's good in the long run at practicing fluidity, but you might be overwhelmed at first.
Great teacher if you are really interested in learning Spanish!

Profesora Amat is awesome. She assigns a ton of reading, but it's interesting and she's good at helping us to understand it. You'll have to look up a lot of words in the reading, but if you do, you'll learn so much in this class.

Dr. Amat's class was wonderful. From the first day of class, she engulfs her students in a world of Spanish. The entire class is conducted in Spanish.  She is entertaining and covers material that is intriguing and teaches students how to embrace the Spanish culture. She assigns work out of book often.  Overall great class.  I highly recommend!

She is a great professor--very funny and makes class entertaining!  She also seems to really love teaching the class.  I'd have to say that she does grade harder than other 203 teachers, and gives significantly more work but all in all a great professor!
Very interesting class. She's an excellent teacher with a superb understanding of the material.
Kinda ditzy, but very approachable.  A tough grader, finds a way to make simple ideas very difficult.  Very average professor.

Very approachable, friendly, and down to earth. Gets to know students and cares about them. The class is fairly difficult, but she grades fairly and definitely prepares you for exams. The only bad part is the daily quizzes.

Pretty easy class, conducted mostly in Spanish.  Native speaker, so she's got a good accent.  If you put in at least an hour of work before every class, you'll do fine.  Good class if you're in it to learn.

Great professor, loves her subject matter, very excited about teaching.  Midterms are very reasonable (in class multiple choice and short answer, plus short take home essay).  There is A LOT of work for this class, tho.  Positive:  easy to make up for bad grade on one thing; negative:...it's a lot of work.  Great prof, if you don't mind constantly having something to get done.
Good teacher.  Gives a lot of hard quizzes though.  Takes attendance!!

GET REAL.  SHE GIVES MOST OF THE CLASS A "B" OR LOWER, REGARDLESS.  FORGET THE CHALLENGE, GRAD SCHOOLS DON'T CARE.  YOU'VE BEEN WARNED, IF YOU TAKE HER CLASS YOUR GPA GOES DOWN.  AVOID AT ALL COSTS. FIND ANOTHER PROFESSOR.  DON'T MAKE A BAD MISTAKE YOUR FRESH. YEAR OR SOPH. YEAR! AWFUL PROFESSOR.

If you're seeking a good challenge and an entertaining class, take Span 21 with her.  Shows lots of enthusiasm in class and grades strictly but very fairly.  She ensures you are well prepared for quizzes/exams and reviews during class. Class is done 99% of the time in Spanish.
Instead of helping, this professor told me to "go see the tutor." I tested out of ALL required spanish classes as Fresh. yet only managed a "B" in her class.   Maybe she has favorites? Be warned!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: I can not stress more how amazing Ms. Amat is! This class was the best I've taken so far- she is excited about the material, engaging and halarious.
